```{r num2}
library(ggplot2)
data(mpg)
models_per_manufacturer <- table(mpg$manufacturer)
manufacturer_most_models <- names(models_per_manufacturer[which.max(models_per_manufacturer)])
cat("Manufacturer with the most models:", manufacturer_most_models, "\n")
variations_per_model <- table(mpg$model)
model_most_variations <- names(variations_per_model[which.max(variations_per_model)])
cat("Model with the most variations:", model_most_variations, "\n")

```

```{r num 2a}
library(ggplot2)
library(dplyr)
data(mpg)
unique_models_by_manufacturer <- mpg %>%
  group_by(manufacturer) %>%
  summarize(unique_models = n_distinct(model))
print(unique_models_by_manufacturer)


```
```{r num 2b}
models_per_manufacturer <- table(mpg$manufacturer)

#Using plot()
plot(models_per_manufacturer, 
     main = "Number of Models by Manufacturer",
     xlab = "Manufacturer",
     ylab = "Number of Models",
     col = "yellow",
     ylim = c(0, max(models_per_manufacturer) + 2))

max_manufacturer <- which.max(models_per_manufacturer)
text(max_manufacturer, models_per_manufacturer[max_manufacturer] + 1,
     labels = paste("Max:", max(models_per_manufacturer)),
     col = "pink", pos = 3)

library(ggplot2)

#Using ggplot2
ggplot(data = as.data.frame(models_per_manufacturer), aes(x = Var1, y = Freq)) +
  geom_bar(stat = "identity", fill = "yellow") +
  labs(title = "Number of Models by Manufacturer",
       x = "Manufacturer",
       y = "Number of Models") +
  geom_text(aes(label = Freq), vjust = -0.3, col = "blue", size = 3) +
  theme_minimal()

```
